channel.title: CVE Feed for Algosec -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Algosec -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-36783|2024-08-03T10:14:28.419Z -- algosec -- fireflow%20a32.0
item.description: AlgoSec â€“ FireFlow Reflected Cross-Site-Scripting (RXSS) A malicious user injects JavaScript code into a parameter called IntersectudRule on the search/result.html page. The malicious user changes the request from POST to GET and sends the URL to another user (victim). JavaScript code is executed on the browser of the other user.

item.title: CVE-2023-46596|2024-08-02T20:45:42.302Z -- algosec -- algosec%20fireflow
item.description: Improper input validation in Algosec FireFlow VisualFlow workflow editor via Name, Description and Configuration File field in version A32.20, A32.50, A32.60 permits an attacker to initiate an XSS attack by injecting malicious executable scripts into the application's code. Fixed in version A32.20 (b600 and above), A32.50 (b430 and above), A32.60 (b250 and above)

item.title: CVE-2023-46596|2024-06-04T17:22:16.471Z -- algosec -- algosec%20fireflow
item.description: Improper input validation in Algosec FireFlow VisualFlow workflow editor via Name, Description and Configuration File field in version A32.20, A32.50, A32.60 permits an attacker to initiate an XSS attack by injecting malicious executable scripts into the application's code. Fixed in version A32.20 (b600 and above), A32.50 (b430 and above), A32.60 (b250 and above)
